Package cz.cuni.mff.java.flightplanner.plugin

Interface Plugin

All Known Implementing Classes:
AirportInfoPlugin, CreateFlightPlanPlugin, ExitFlightPlannerPlugin, WeatherInfoPlugin
public interface Plugin
Plugin interface represents an independent part of the program performing its own action(). This interface provides all the important attributes of a plugin object. The interface also includes several static methods which do not have to be tied with the implementation of the interface.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int action()
    The main method of the implementation of the Plugin interface.
    static void checkActivePlugins​(java.util.List<Plugin> active)
    This method checks whether "exit" plugin is included in the list of plugins to perform.
    java.lang.String description()  
    java.lang.String keyword()  
    static java.util.List<Plugin> loadAllPlugins()
    loadAllPlugins method searches for all Plugin implementations defined in the plugin package and adds new class instance for each of the implementations to the list which will determine all possible actions for the Flight Planner.
    java.lang.String name()  
    java.lang.Integer pluginID()  
    static void returnActivePlugins​(java.util.List<Plugin> fromList, java.util.List<Plugin> toList)
    Returns the deleted plugins into the available plugins list.
    static void startPlugins​(java.util.List<Plugin> active)
    Launches every active plugin and prints the concluding message output specified by the exit code of currently performed action.

  • Method Details

    • loadAllPlugins

      static java.util.List<Plugin> loadAllPlugins()
      loadAllPlugins method searches for all Plugin implementations defined in the plugin package and adds new class instance for each of the implementations to the list which will determine all possible actions for the Flight Planner.
      Returns:
      The list of all available plugins in the given package.
      See Also:
      DialogCenter

    • startPlugins

      static void startPlugins​(java.util.List<Plugin> active)
      Launches every active plugin and prints the concluding message output specified by the exit code of currently performed action.
      Parameters:
      active - List of all plugins to be launched.

    • returnActivePlugins

      static void returnActivePlugins​(java.util.List<Plugin> fromList, java.util.List<Plugin> toList)
      Returns the deleted plugins into the available plugins list.
      Parameters:
      fromList - The plugins to be added to the toList parameter.
      toList - The destination list for the fromList parameter.

    • checkActivePlugins

      static void checkActivePlugins​(java.util.List<Plugin> active)
      This method checks whether "exit" plugin is included in the list of plugins to perform. If so, then this plugin is activated immediately. Otherwise, the user is informed about the plugins that are going to be performed.
      Parameters:
      active - The list of modules which have been activated.

    • name

      java.lang.String name()
      Returns:
      The name of the class implementing this interface.

    • description

      java.lang.String description()
      Returns:
      A brief description of the class which implements this interface.

    • keyword

      java.lang.String keyword()
      Returns:
      The keyword of the class which implements this interface.

    • pluginID

      java.lang.Integer pluginID()
      Returns:
      A unique ID number of the class which implements this interface.

    • action

      int action()
      The main method of the implementation of the Plugin interface. Represents the operation to be performed in order to create a part of the flight plan.
      Returns:
      The exit code of the action. Any non-zero number means that an issue was encountered during the execution of the action.
